t: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
The*pn Lord*s is great and highly praised in*ln the city of our God. His*ln holy mountain,
rising splendidly, is*ln the joy of the whole earth. Mount*ln Zion - the summit of Zaphon - is*ln the city of the great King.
God*ln is known as a stronghold in*ln its citadels.
Look!*pn The kings assembled; they*ln advanced together.
They*ln looked and froze with fear; they*ln fled in terror.
Trembling*ln seized them there, agony*ln like that of a woman in labor,
as*ln you wrecked the ships of Tarshish with*ln the east wind.
Just*pn as we heard, so we have seen in*ln the city of the Lord*s of Armies, in*ln the city of our God; God*ln will establish it forever. Selah*ig
God,*pn within your temple, we*ln contemplate your faithful love.
Like*ln your name, God, so your praise reaches*ln to the ends of the earth; your*ln right hand is filled with justice.
Mount*ln Zion is glad. Judah’s*ln villages rejoice because*ln of your judgments.
Go*pn around Zion, encircle it; count*ln its towers,
note*ln its ramparts; tour its citadels so*ln that you can tell a future generation:
“This*ln God, our God forever and ever — he*ln will always lead us.”
